messages.content: How do I implement JWT authentication in Go? I need to validate tokens from a third-party provider.

To validate JWT tokens from a third-party provider in Go, you need to fetch their JWKS (JSON Web Key Set) endpoint and verify signatures. Here's the key insight: the `github.com/golang-jwt/jwt/v5` library supports JWKS validation natively.
You already have the jwt library. Use `jwk.Fetch` to get the JWKS from the provider URL, then pass it as the key function to `jwt.Parse`. Important gotcha: JWKS are cached but you should refresh them on 401 responses from downstream services.
